alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Hancock; Hawkins (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 12:06AM CDT until August 01 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN CLAIBORNE, HANCOCK, NORTHERN HAWKINS AND SOUTHWESTERN SCOTT COUNTIES... At 106 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Hancock County local law enforcement has reported several small streams out their banks into area roadways across the county, including in the city of Sneedville. Up to 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingsport, Rogersville, Gate City, Sneedville, Surgoinsville, Church Hill, Mount Carmel, Kyles Ford, Evanston, Okolona and Howard Quarter. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
